item.description: Online interactive session on the music of Hildegard von Bingen via the International Chant Academy. Click for more information and registration.

item.title: Hildegard StudyDay Online via ICA
item.description:
Hildegard StudyDay Online via International Chant Academy

In May, Marsja successfully collaborated with the International Chant Academy in the USA, giving an online lecture and two practical sessions as part of their Hands on With Hildegard lecture series. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive, with the depth and interdisciplinary approach particularly appreciated. By popular demand, the collaboration will continue with three more practical online sessions (via Zoom), the third of which is scheduled for November 17th. This is ideal for those who are unable to attend the monthly Hildegard Study Days in the Den Bosch area due to distance or time constraints. Click here for more information and registration.

In May, Marsja successfully collaborated with the International Chant Academy in the USA, giving an online lecture and two practical sessions as part of their Hands on With Hildegard lecture series. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive, with the depth and interdisciplinary approach particularly appreciated. By popular demand, the collaboration will continue with three more practical online sessions (via Zoom), the second of which is scheduled for November 1st. This is ideal for those who are unable to attend the monthly Hildegard Study Days in the Den Bosch area due to distance or time constraints. Click here for more information and registration.

item.title: Hildegard StudyDay Online via ICA
item.description:
Hildegard StudyDay Online via International Chant Academy

In May, Marsja successfully collaborated with the International Chant Academy in the USA, giving an online lecture and two practical sessions as part of their Hands on With Hildegard lecture series. The feedback was overwhelmingly positive, with the depth and interdisciplinary approach particularly appreciated. By popular demand, the collaboration will continue with three more practical online sessions (via Zoom), the first of which is scheduled for September 5th. This is ideal for those who are unable to attend the monthly Hildegard Study Days in the Den Bosch area due to distance or time constraints. Click here for more information and registration.

item.title: Cantico del Sole Concert at Kloosterkerk Megen 15:00
item.description:
Canticle of the Sun Concert at Kloosterkerk Megen

In a double concert with the Herz Ensemble, which presents modern musical settings of the Canticle of the Sun by Francis of Assisi, the ensemble Anime Beatitudinis Cantando performs the lively program Sia Laudato, San Francesco!, also inspired by the anniversary of the Canticle and the life of Francis. Especially for this program, Cristina Garcia Martin created stunning modern animations, drawing inspiration from the frescoes Giotto painted in the church above Francisâ€™s tomb in Assisi.

item.title: Mastering Modal Methods and Manners for Modal Music, Public Demonstration
item.description:
Mastering Modal Methods and Manners for Modal Music: Public Demonstration

Students of the course Mastering Modal Methods and Manners for Modal Music and their teachers, dr. Rebecca Stewart, drs. Bram Verheijen and drs. Marsja Mudde, will demonstrate what they have learned these past 3 days. They will sing the chant they studied and share their “aha-moments” with the public.
